screen_desc: The screenshot shows the mobile website of Target.com as viewed on a smartphone. The site is promoting their service where customers can get top gifts with free pickup or have them delivered by a service called Shipt. There's a highlighted message saying "There's still time!" and "Finish your gift list" accompanied by a visual of wrapped gift packages, suggesting urgency in completing holiday shopping. Customers are encouraged to explore gift ideas through a link provided. The website interface includes a search bar, navigation menu, and a shopping cart icon, indicating that users can browse and shop for items directly from their mobile device.
action_think: To clear the shopping cart on Target.com, I need to access the cart first. On the current screen, I can see the shopping cart icon at the top right corner of the Target website interface. I should click on this icon to view the cart. After accessing the cart, I can then proceed to remove items if there are any. Once the cart is empty, the next part of the user request involves adding a 'usb-c' item to the cart, which will require searching for 'usb-c' on the website, selecting an appropriate item, and adding it to the cart.
action_plan: Click on the shopping cart icon at the top right corner of the website to view the shopping cart.
Remove all items from the shopping cart if necessary.
Search for 'usb-c' in the search bar.
Select a 'usb-c' item from the search results.
Add the 'usb-c' item to the cart.
action_desc: Click on the shopping cart icon at the top right corner of the website.
action_result: By clicking on the search bar located at the upper left in the last screenshot, the current screen now displays the search interface with a text input area and a list of "Trending searches." This is a direct consequence of engaging the search functionality on the Target website. This action has made progress towards the user request because typing a query such as "usb-c" into the search bar is necessary to find and select the desired item to add to the shopping cart. However, it is also important to first clear the shopping cart, as per the user request, which has not been addressed by this action. The next step should be to navigate to the shopping cart to remove any existing items before adding a new item.
